title: House Republicans Approve Impeachment Inquiry into Joe Biden
description: The resolution, which passed along party lines, doesn't accuse Biden of wrongdoing but authorizes congressional committees to continue investigating.

title: DEI Is Not the Monster Here
description: "It requires a tricky magic to transform DEI into the latest bogeyman and the reason for the rise of antisemitism on college campuses," writes Eddie Glaude Jr.

title: Anthony Anderson to Host Strike-Delayed Emmy Awards
description: Anthony Anderson has been nominated for multiple Emmy Awards, and now he'll be presiding over January's strike-delayed ceremony

title: Walter Isaacson On Musk’s Legacy and Criticism of His Biography
description: Walter Isaacson talks about criticism of his biography, Musk's growing influence, and how Twitter shapes his legacy.

title: Was COP28 A Success or Flop? Depends Who You Ask
description: The COP28 climate conference in Dubai ended with an agreement that acknowledges fossil fuels' harm but does little to limit climate change.

title: Federal Reserve Keeps Key Interest Rate Unchanged
description: Policymakers also signaled that they expect to make three quarter-point cuts to their benchmark interest rate next year.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Case That Could Undo Capitol Riot Charge Against Hundreds, Including Trump
description: The justices will review a charge of obstruction of an official proceeding against more than 300 people.

title: U.S. Is Called Out Over Voting Against Gaza Ceasefire During the U.N. General Assembly
description: A total of 153 countries voted for a ceasefire, with only 10 member states—including the U.S.—voting against the resolution.

title: Apollo 13 and Home Alone Among 25 Films Picked for National Registry
description: "Apollo 13" and "Home Alone," are among 25 movies being selected for preservation in the National Film Registry this year.

title: How the West Can Make Russian Sanctions Bite Again
description: Hefty sanctions following Putin's full-scale invasion of Ukraine came hard and fast. But their effect has been wearing off.

title: Poor Things and the Profoundly Feminist Origins of Frankenstein
description: 'Poor Things' owes its free-spirited feminism to the complicated legacy of Mary Shelley and 'Frankenstein.'

title: The National Remorse That Follows Wartime Actions Against Civilians
description: The U.S. learned this lesson during World War II—and it should guide those countries at war in 2023.

title: After Recalls and Infections, Experts Say Safer Eyedrops Will Require New FDA Powers
description: Recalls involving over-the-counter eyedrops are drawing attention to just how little U.S. officials know about manufacturing plants abroad.

title: An Author Review Bombed Books on Goodreads. Then Her Debut Book Was Dropped
description: Author Cait Corrain was dropped by her agent and publisher after "review bombing" other writers on Goodreads

title: Supreme Court Will Hear Case on Abortion Pill Access
description: It will be the Supreme Court's first abortion case since it overturned Roe v. Wade last year.

title: Tesla Recalls Nearly All Vehicles Sold in U.S. to Fix System That Monitors Drivers Using Autopilot
description: Tesla is recalling nearly all of the vehicles it sold in the U.S. to fix a system that monitors drivers using Autopilot.

title: Biden to Meet In-Person With Families of Americans Taken Hostage by Hamas
description: President Joe Biden will hold his first in-person meeting with the families of Americans presumed to be taken captive by Hamas.

title: 5 Ways that Inequality Improved This Year
description: From increasing family wealth to declines in violent crime, America is become equal in important ways, writes Jeremy Ney.

title: Dengue Fever Is Soaring Worldwide. Here’s What to Know—and How to Stay Protected
description: The mosquito-borne virus has a long history in warm climates but is now also emerging in regions where it had been generally unheard of—such as in Europe and parts of the U.S.

title: The Thorny History Behind Wedding Plus-Ones
description: Plus-ones or plus-nones? That is the question, writes Terri Pous.

title: COP28 Ends With Historic Deal to ‘Transition Away’ From Planet-Warming Fossil Fuels
description: The COP28 climate talks in Dubai ended in a deal that saw a commitment to transition away from all fossil fuels for the first time.

title: Dozens Injured in Russian Missile Attack on Kyiv as Zelensky Seeks Support in Washington
description: The attack came as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited Washington, where he made an impassioned plea to Congress to approve additional aid to fight Russia’s invasion.

title: AP’s Words of the Year From Around the World
description: The Associated Press highlights several terms that emerged this year and seized or crystalized the popular mood in various countries.

title: Japan’s Fumio Kishida Faces Ruling Party’s Biggest Political Scandal in Decades
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is struggling to rein in the widest financial scandal to hit his long-ruling Liberal Democratic Party in more than three decades.

title: The Vatican Softens Its Rules for Catholics on Keeping Ashes of the Dead
description: Catholic families may now request to preserve a small portion of their late relative’s cremated remains in a “place of significance” to them. instead of strictly at a church or a cemetery.

title: Youth Climate Activist Claire Vlases Accepts TIME Earth Award After Major Legal Victory
description: The 20-year-old helped secure victory in a landmark climate case in Montana earlier this year.

title: Andre Braugher, Emmy-Winning Actor Known for Brooklyn Nine-Nine and Homicide, Dies at 61
description: The Chicago-born actor had his breakthrough role in 1989's “Glory,” and won two career Emmys from 11 nominations.

title: Padma Lakshmi on the Importance of Telling Immigrant Stories
description: As Padma Laskhmi accepted a TIME100 Impact Award, she spoke about immigrants—and how her advocacy work has led her to dive more deeply into telling their stories.

title: Biden Reaffirms Support for Ukraine, But Issues a Warning to Israel
description: The two moments highlighted the balancing act for Biden, as opposition to Israel's bombing of Gaza grows.
